channel.title: Tils on Raphael Brugier
channel.description: Recent content in Tils on Raphael Brugier

item.title: How to find your ip with command line
item.description: When you need to determine your public IP - eg for a script - you can use some public websites as an API with Curl: For example, I have used ifconfig.me: $ curl ifconfig.me 57.22.56.xxx Alternatively, the dig command is faster: $ dig +short myip.opendns.com @resolver1.opendns.com 57.22.56.xxx

item.title: How to debug zsh startup time
item.description: Use the zprof module to profile the zsh functions. Add zmodload zsh/zprof at the beginning of the .zshrc file. Add zprof at the end to print the result of the profling. In my case the problem was nvm due to this issue. source

item.title: remove known_hosts entry with ssh keygen
item.description: The easiest way to remove an entry from the .ssh/known_hosts file is to use ssh-keygen: ssh-keygen -R hostname
